text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Nintendo DS (Dual Screen) released late 2004 in Japan is the new Nintendo portable console to compete with Sony's PlayStation Portable. Equipped with a 66 Mhz processor then 133 Mhz with the DSi, 4 then 16 MB of RAM, 128 sprites max or 120 000 second polygons, two backlit screens of 256 × 192 pixels including one as touch screen, a stylus, a microphone and WIFI to play online via internet or LAN with 16 other consoles, it’s the best-selling console of all time. In 2006 comes out the DS Lite which is smaller and in 2009 the DSi XL with screens 30% larger.
